title: Help wanted to identify these 2 fonts
content:
Does anyone recognise either of these 2 fonts?  
They both look infuriatingly familiar, especially the serif...  
Any help would be appreciated, and thanks for looking.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819232428im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TypeID_2013-04-10%20at%2011_4105.06.43%20PM.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819232428im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TypeID_2013-04-10%20at%2011_6451.06.05%20PM.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [TypeID\_2013-04-10 at 11.06.43 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819232428/http:/typophile.com/files/TypeID_2013-04-10%20at%2011.06.43%20PM.png) | 118.26 KB |
| [TypeID\_2013-04-10 at 11.06.05 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819232428/http:/typophile.com/files/TypeID_2013-04-10%20at%2011.06.05%20PM.png) | 150.03 KB |
author: DerekDooley

comments.content: "Love in the Years of Lunacy": [Montague Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819232428/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/stephen-rapp/montague-script) using some alternates (/ [L](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819232428/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/stephen-rapp/montague-script/regular/glyphs.html#glyphs/561455/279), / [Y](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819232428/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/stephen-rapp/montague-script/regular/glyphs.html#glyphs/561455/317)...)
Still missing "Turbulence" which looks like some sort of Garamond Italic but I have not identified it yet.
Thanks Akira! Was far from finding it actually.
